Ophelia had always known it was important to save money. She decided one day to open up a savings account at her bank. She took some money from her checking account to open up the account. Her banker congratulated her on taking the first step toward saving. Ophelia feels proud of herself.

Kenya crossed the street in order to walk towards her house. She noticed a strange scarecrow in front of the porch. Since it wasn't moving, she walked past it. However, it jumped as soon as she took her attention away. Kenya screamed.

Pat woke up with the urge to play hooky from work. So he called in that morning using a fake sick voice. Not even an hour after calling in he gets a text. It tells him work is cancelled because it's snowing. Pat got in his car and drove to work.

Brad and Allison love Texas country music. Brad found out there was a concert happening nearby. He invited Allison to go to the concert with him. Allison accepted the invitation. They both had a good time at the concert.

In had been ten Years since Ted was in high school. He was bullied every day by Joel, the all star jock. Ted's life is better now, he really has everything he could want. As he was sitting down for lunch he saw a guy wiping tables. Ted was happy to see his buddy Bob.

Johnny thought Anita was the girl for him, but he was wrong. He invited her out but she said she didn't feel well. Johnny decided to go to a club, just to drink and listen to music. At midnight, he looked back and saw Anita dancing with another guy. Johnny did not ask Anita out again.
Helen wanted to go to space. She decided to become an astronaut. She studied very hard. She  passed all the tests! Helen looked forward to her first mission.

Harry was tired of the hot summer days. He decided to go swimming with his friends. Harry called his friends and set up the plans. They all met up at a local lake and drank beer and swam. Harry and his friends had a great time at the lake.

Jane met Greg in an internet chat room. They agreed to meet at starbucks for coffee. They hit it off surprisingly well. They agreed to meet again the next day. Jane thought Greg might be a potential boyfriend.

Pam was looking for a house to buy. After a few months of looking, she finally found a house she loved. However, it was a little too expensive. Pam tried to talk down the price, and succeeded. Pam finally bought the house.

We went to Portland, Maine for a family vacation in 2006. We saw the art museum. We visited the waterfront and had dinner on a ship. We watched a minor league baseball game. Our vacation was a failure because there was nothing to do.

Jessica likes to get coffee before work. One morning she was running five minutes late. When she got to the coffee shop, the line was very long. She had to go to work without coffee that morning. She was frustrated all morning.
I decided to murder my neighbor. I crept into his house in the middle of the night. I killed him while he slept. I was caught by the police. The police officer gave me a badge and made me a deputy.

Rich had worked in the woods for Years. He spent most of his days alone and his nights drinking. As he got older he realized his lifestyle needed to change. He went to Alcoholics Anonymous and sobered up. Rich was successful in Alcoholics Anonymous and became a sponsor.

Sarah had a fear of being around others. She decided to force herself to go to a party. At the party, she became dizzy and nervous. Sarah decided this was enough, and went to see a therapist. The therapist taught her ways to cope with her problem.

A boy Jack had been asking his parents to get a puppy for months. After all the time he asked they finally gave in and said yes. Jack spent about thirty minutes looking online for a puppy. He found one in the area that he lived. Jack then showed the online puppy and pleaded with them to get it.

Mary Ann went for a walk on a trail at the park. She passed people with children and animals. She passed people jogging and riding bikes. She saw a lot of plants. Mary Ann got a rash from one of them because it was poison ivy.

Karen was a softball player. Her team wasn't doing very well. Her coach gave them a very inspiring speech. Everyone started to practice and work much harder. Karen felt unmotivated after hearing the speech.

Bob decided to hike in the jungles of Indonesia. He bought a plane ticket and packed his bags. When he arrived, he realized he forgot his malaria vaccine. He decided to hike the jungle regardless. Bob had also forgotten his shoes.

I went out to a casual dinner with a group of friends. We went to a local Mexican restaurant. I had nachos and a couple of beers. We talked and laughed for a couple of hours. We had a great time together.

Kimmy was on a trip to Paris. Her plane had just landed and she and her classmates her excited. They couldn't wait to start seeing museums and churches! They spent lots of time shopping and seeing historical sites. Kimmy was very excited.
Pablo wanted a jawbreaker. He had no money however. He went through his closet to see what he could sell. He found a toy bear and sold it for 50 cents. He bought some soda with it.

Bob got ready for the children's performance. He got out his makeup kit and washed his face. He applied a coat of white paint. He then drew varying colors of rings around his eyes and mouth. Bob enjoyed entertaining the kids.
Priya decided to try a new restaurant. She drove to a new cafe that opened. Priya sat at a booth. She ordered a mimosa and a breakfast burrito. Priya thought her food was delicious.

Tami decided to attend volleyball tryouts. She was only in the 8th grade, but she knew she was good. She played hard and gave it her all. She hadn't anticipated the other players would be as good as her. Tami made the basketball team.

Matt started playing baseball when he was seven. Now seventeen Year's old he still had not hit a homerun. Today was not only his last game, it was also the championship. Bottom of ninth, Matt was up at bat with two strikes to his name Matt scored a touchdown at the last minute.

Allie lost 50 pounds. The doctor told her she needed to lose 10 more. If she lost 10 more he would do skin removal. Allie dieted hard and exercised. Allie was able to lose the 10 pounds and have the skin removal.
Jack went on a trip to the store. He really needed to buy some eggs. He looked everywhere but could not find them! He asked the clerk where they were. The clerk told him where the bacon was located.
Kelly was nervous today. It was her first day of school. She was the new kid. Thankfully however she made new friends when she got there. She was in a class with the same kids from last year.
Kelly loved a boy named Steve. They spent everyday together. One day Steve asked Kelly to marry him. She said yes. They hated one another from the start.

The teacher announced that there would be a pop quiz. The students let out a collective groan. This was the second pop quiz in a week. As the teacher began handing out the quizzes, the fire alarm rang. The students cheered because they were free.

Alice was a dog trainer. She never came across a dog she couldn't help. One day, a man brought a dog named Henry to Alice. Henry was very withdrawn due to a bad first owner. Alice worked with him and he became more obedient.
Zeke was throwing a Halloween party. All his friends were dressing up. Zeke thought about being a vampire or a wizard. Then he decided on a scarier costume. Zeke dressed up like a skeleton.

Steph usually ate a large breakfast. But her new job meant she had less time to make food. So Steph decided to eat simpler food and smaller portions. And in a month, she lost 10 pounds. She felt like a complete failure.

Joe went on vacation. He went to an island that had a large volcano. Joe's friends dared him to climb into the volcano. Joe decided it was something he needed to do. Joe slipped and paid the ultimate price.

I used to be fat. At 18 Year's old I was 280 pounds. I knew my life would suck forever if I didn't change that. I worked my ass off for three Years with intense diet and exercise. I weight 299 pounds.

Ethan was moving into an apartment downtown. He really didn't consider the changes he'd make going from a house. So it really hit hard when he set up his drum set. Within ten minutes he had five noise complaints. He was happy people liked his drum playing.

My friend and I had a little contest the other day. We tried to see who could blow the biggest bubblegum bubble. We took different turns and would take measurements. When his was getting at it's biggest I popped it. He was a little mad, but I just laughed.
Jill was hungry. But it was 2 AM. She tried to prepare food quietly. But she caused a lot of noise with pots and pans. She woke up her roommate.

Quentin ordinarily does not enjoy going to company events. Although he doesn't mind coworkers, he likes to be left alone. One day he decides to attend a company party. He eats some french fries to help himself from feeling awkward. Quentin loved all being their with all the people.
Todd collected and raised lovebirds. He had 12 in all. His apartment stank from the animals. Todd didn't mind the smell. He pinched his nose constantly avoid the smell.
Sam wanted to lose some weight. He decided to run everyday after dinner. He eventually built up his endurance. Sam felt great after exercising consistently. He immediately quit exercising.

Cindy cooked and cleaned every single day. She grew tired of doing all the cooking and cleaning by herself. Cindy said she was not going to cook until she got help cleaning. The family had beans every night until they realized she was serious. The family started to help.
Tom was hiking one day. He always traveled on the path. Soon, the path split into two. He didn't know where to go. He turned and went back home instead.

Tim's arch enemy on the playground made a sudden appearance. This was during the 3rd period break, a time normally Tim was alone. Tim mustered up his courage to go face his arch enemy. He approached Jane and told her to stay away from him. Tim asked Jane to play on the merry go round.
Today is Hope's Birthday. She jumps out of bed excited. She rushed to the bathroom to take a shower. After her shower, she gets ready. Hope is having breakfast with her family.

Gina's friend Mary wouldn't share. They both needed to use the school library books about dolphins. But Mary had beaten Gina and taken them all. And now she refused to share the books. Gina's mother had to call Mary's mom to complain.

Dirk was a fine pianist. He often performed out in public for money. During his last performance, one of the keys broke off his keyboard. He finished the performance as best he could, but the music was poor. Dirk was embarrassed.

Ann woke up in the middle of the night. She was thirsty and wanted a drink of water. She tiptoed into the kitchen and got a drink. But then she accidentally dropped the glass, which shattered! Ann quickly cleaned up the broken glass and threw it away.

Portia loves walking through the woods nearby her house. However, she notices that her sneakers are becoming muddy and gross. She decides to buy a pair of hiking boots. Portia finds a pair that is comfortable and not too expensive. She donates the boots to the thrift store.

Gary has a crush on Jamie. He gets very nervous around her. One day, he tried to show off in front of her. Instead, he fell down a flight of stairs. Gary was mad that he didn't fall down two flights of stairs.

Barry loves playing baseball. Barry decided that he would go and watch a professional game. Barry went to the stadium, and purchased a ticket. Upon entering, Barry decided to grab a beer to drink. Barry decided to leave the game.

My friend and I had a little contest the other day. We tried to see who could blow the biggest bubblegum bubble. We took different turns and would take measurements. When his was getting at it's biggest I popped it. He never did understand the best way to fry an egg.

Billy loved to eat apples and healthy foods. He shared his loved of fruit with his family and friends. When he was older, he bought an orchard and raised apples. The apples tasted very good and were enjoyed by many. Billy could not grow good apple trees or apples.

John was working on a science project display for school. When he finished his project, he placed it by his bedroom window. After putting the project down, John left the room and watched tv. While watching TV, John's dog destroyed his project. John then failed the project because of his dog.
I just completed my first marathon today. It was about six miles and I worked real hard. I trained for it for about three months. It's always been on my to do list in life I've never been happier.

Josh played basketball every day. His goal was to be able to make any basket on the court. One day, someone challenged him to a contest. Whoever makes the most shots would be the winner! John ran away screaming in terror.

Reilly loved going to the fair. The petting zoo was her favorite part. She had fed a small goat before feeding the cow. The goat was trying to get more food from her but she ignored it. Eventually, the goat became angry and bit Reilly.

Paul worked as order taker at a fast food drive thru. Customers noticed he had a really nice voice. People suggested he should work in radio. Paul quit his job at the fast food restaurant. Paul got a new job as a radio dj.

I went to babysit my 5-year-old nephew in San Francisco. My sister encouraged me to bike her kid to school. I was afraid to bike across the city with my nephew in tow. Instead, we biked through Golden Gate Park to the beach and the zoo. I do not have a sister.

May was Harry's favorite month. Harry had his birthday in May and school also let out. Every May Harry would also go to the country to see his friend Mary. Mary and Harry got engaged eventually. Harry loved Mary.

Charles thought Sherry was a poor girl, and he loved her. Sherry had been on unemployment for a year, since Charles met her. One day, Sherry was very busy and savvy finding a job. She landed a position as a loan officer in a bank. Charles lost interest in Sherry when she became self supporting.

When the waiter returned to the table the customers looked ready. She asked the woman what she wanted to eat. The woman began to speak and then stopped. She was no longer sure what she wanted. The waiter gave them more time.

Jake was going on a road trip to see his family. He Got in the car and drove. The car's tires exploded due to too much air. Jake hitchhiked for 30 miles. When Jake got to his family he was happy his trip was over.
Scott loves rock climbing. He competes against himself. He sets personal goals and tries to beat them. Last week he set a personal best. He went out to dinner with his best friend to celebrate.

Jill bought a pickaxe and went down to the mine. John saw her on her way. He told her that women can't work in the mine. So she swung her pickaxe right through his skull. John then fell down and died.

Marco is starting a new job today. He wants to look good on his first day. Marco decides to put on a necktie. His new boss is impressed with how good he looks. Marco is horrified by the reaction of his boss.

Rory was allergic to gluten and strawberries. One day she sat down to eat lunch at school. She opened her lunch box, and stared at a sandwich with strawberries. Her new step mom had packed her lunch for the first time. Rory had to buy a school lunch that day.

Bob was playing volleyball. He suddenly felt very dizzy and fell down. His friends quickly rushed to his aid. Bob was dehydrated from exerting himself. Bob said he felt bloated from drinking too much water.
My friend and his wife were unhappy for a while. They tried to work it out many times. Both cared for each other deeply. But the differences were just too big. They got divorced.
Neil wanted to play hockey. He borrowed some gear from his friends. Then he geared up and headed to the rink. He practiced for days. Neil played in the competition.
Tiana was so hungry. She decided to buy a burger! She went to a fast food restaurant and ordered the burger she wanted. When she received the burger, she ate it immediately. Tina was satisfied.
Brenda was at summer camp. She was lying in bed and trying to go to sleep. Suddenly, she heard a spooky noise. The noise terrified her and kept up all night. Branda awoke feeling refreshed.

Gina was using a restroom at a gas station. She went to wash her hands, but there was no soap. She looked in the cabinet under the sink hoping to find some. There was no soap there either. Gina stole al the soap that was in the bathroom.

Tina wanted to go for a hike so she put her baby in a baby carrier. They were walking up the trail in the park near their house. Suddenly, in front of them, she spotted a long black snake! After screaming, she ran home to tell her husband. Tina's husband suggested it would make a good pet.

Little Lola lost her library book from her school's library. She wasn't allowed to take out another until she returned it. Lila and her mother fruitlessly searched the house from top to bottom. Her mother finally ordered a new copy to replace what they had lost. Lola promised to be more careful in the future.

Eric was shooting hoops in his driveway. All of a sudden it started to rainy. Eric slipped on a puddle in his driveway. He fell down and scraped his elbow. Eric started crying and went to find his mommy.
Jake was at the grocery store. He was trying to pick melons. Someone noticed he was confused. She went over and tried to explain which were best. Jake finally chose a melon that he thought was ripe.

Anne always wanted one of the lilies that grew in the pond. They were so far out, she could never reach them. One summer she took a rake and attempted to pull one in. To her shock, she still could not get the lily! Anne was very sad.

Reba worried that she was going to be a killer, like her father. He went to prison for murder. Reba spent her entire life doing good deeds. She became a nun, and comforted orphaned children. Reba was just like her dad.

Gina's dad turned on the water hose for her. He watched as she sprayed the soda spill on the porch. It had been sitting there for hours. It was a dried gooey mess by the time she began cleaning it. Gina licked her plate clean.
I once got lost in the woods. It was very hot. I soon got really thirsty. I felt like I was going to die. I nearly died of frostbite.

Dal needed money to go to college. He started doing the accounting for a local gang. When the feds raided the gang, he was going over their books. He was accidentally shot dead in the crossfire. Dal made a smart decision.

My children and I visited the local animal shelter. We looked at puppies and kittens in their cages. My daughters picked out a friendly puppy. They played with her and rubbed her belly. I decided to buy her a candy bar instead.

When I turned eighteen, I registered to vote. I was so excited to participate in the democratic process. I did research on each and every candidate. When voting day came, I went to the polling station. I was sad when my candidate lost the election.
Todd collected and raised lovebirds. He had 12 in all. His apartment stank from the animals. Todd didn't mind the smell. The smell reminded him of his love for his birds.

James notices that he has become increasingly depressed. He feels alone, and does not know who to talk to. Finally his mother recommends that he began seeing a therapist. James begins regularly seeing a therapist and starts to feel better. James decides to become a therapist when he grows up.

Tom's favorite team was playing in the playoff games. He ran home to turn on the television just in time. He watched the game and cheered when his team made a touchdown. His team won the game. Tom was sad.
Colin was invited to the bar by his friends. He loves beer but thinks it's too expensive at the bars. He decided to go anyway. He gave himself a budget. Colin drinks beer at the bar all night.

Kim had dropped her toothbrush in the toilet. She was disgusted by the thought of putting her hand in to pull it out. She grabbed a pair of scissors out of the drawer. Each time she had the toothbrush she would drop it. Kim finished brushing her teeth and smiled.
Mowgli had just moved to Los Angeles. She lived in Tennessee her whole life. Her first night in California she went out to look at the stars. She used to always do that growing up. She felt at home.

James woke up and was in a bad mood immediately. He went too fix breakfast and burnt his toast. Then went to get dressed and couldn't find any socks. James decided it was a bad day and he was going back to bed. James was having a great morning.
Last night I had the best pizza. I went to bertucci's and had a pepperoni pizza. The sauce was delectable and the meat was divine. I ate the entire thing. I won't eat pizza for a long time.

The Bradley family decided to take a camping trip. They packed the car for the two hour trip. Once they arrived it was almost dark and began to storm. After the rain had passed they set up the tent and started the fire. The Bradleys then had a great camping trip.

Ben has always wanted to learn how to play piano. Now that his children are grown up, he has more spare time. Ben enrolls in a piano class with a local tutor. Although it is difficult, he is dedicated to learning. He gets better with every lesson.
Ben wanted to sell his rocking chair. He had it for 20 Years. He dusted it off and put a for sale sign on it. He placed it in his yard so people would see. Ben decided to keep the chair instead.

Becky and her friends decided to make some candy bars. The got all the ingredients together and got to it. The girls had a ton of fun. When the candy cooled they put them in bags. The girls decided they never wanted to make candy bars again.

I don't believe in luck. But my girlfriend's dad broke a mirror yesterday. Not even five second later he slammed his hand in the car door. Then on his way to the hospital he hits a deer. I no longer consider golf a sport.

Neil was traveling through France. He had spent a few days in Calais. Then he wanted to see the sights in Nice. He hopped on a train and journeyed east. When he got off the train, he enjoyed the west immensely.

Greg was riding his bike to the store. An arm emerged from an alleyway as Greg passed. Greg fell from the bike as he was pushed to the ground. He watched from the sidewalk as a man rode away with his bike. Greg filed a police report and they eventually caught the thief.

Tim just got a new phone. He had dropped it a few time hours within getting it. He decided he needed a case to protect his phone. He went to the local store and purchased a waterproof phone case. Tim's phone became ruined when he spilled water on it.

Sal was nervous on his first day of high school. And as he sat in class, he felt intimidated by his peers. At lunch time, another student approached him. And that student felt the same way as Sal. Sal found out he wasn't alone.

Jill wanted to knit her boyfriend a sweater. She taught herself how to knit and bought supplies. She finished the sweater just in time for her boyfriend's birthday. Jill was excited as she presented her boyfriend with her creation. Jill's boyfriend was delighted to receive a ticket to Disneyland.

The light didn't come on when Jerry flipped the switch in his room. He had to go to the store to buy lightbulbs the next day. He carefully removed the old bulb. The new one was then screwed into place. Jerry discovered it was the switch that was broken.

Bob had recently just purchased his dream car. The only thing he didn't like about it was the color. He took it to the paint shop to get it repainted. He waited a week and then picked it up from the shop. Bob loved the new color he chose.

Ted tried out for the baseball team at school. He did not make the team though. His coach told him he needed to be able to it the ball better. Teddy spent the next year practicing his baseball swing. He tried out for the team again and this time, he made it.

Harry shopped a lot online and was looking to buy a new camera. He researched different cameras online and decided to buy one. He made the purchase and the camera arrived in the mail the next week. When Harry opened the package, he found that the camera was damaged. Harry spent the evening happily taking pictures.

I promised my wife I would learn to water ski. We went with her family out to the lake. When it was my turn to ski, I was too afraid. I made up a story about my legs hurting. I felt very proud of myself.

Vianna went to church on a Saturday. She sat in the pew and listened to the sermon. The sermon was very interesting and she had questions. She decided to ask the speaker about some questions she had. Vianna suddenly decided she didn't have any questions.

Lucy was nervous during her first job interview. She answered all of the questions accurately. Lucy waited for three days after the interview to contact the company. The company notified her that the job was hers. Lucy was so disappointed.
Jeb was building statues out of rocks. He made one that looked like a turtle. Sam came and knocked it down. Jeb started crying. Sam laughed and ran away.
My friend visited me from California. We went to his van, smoked and talked. Time went by fast as we caught up. My friend told me that he had to go. My friend insulted me and then walked away.

Josh woke up early to get ready for the hike he had been planning. After a shower, he made sure all his supplies were packed. He left his house and drove to the park where he was going hiking. Because it was early in the day Josh had the trail mostly to himself. Josh loved the outdoors.
Amanda dropped her phone in the water. She picked the phone up. She tried to turn the phone on. The phone did not work. Amanda had to get a new phone.

Maya was walking home one night from work. She fumbled with her keys while trying to get into her car. Someone began approaching her from a dark alley. Frightened, she quickly got into her car and started it. Maya started to laugh.

Dennis entered a surfing competition. He did poorly at first, and he fell off a lot. Later he did much better as the competition winded down. Then he got the best wave of his life. Dennis won the competition.

I've gotten three speeding tickets in my life. All three of them when I was a teenager. I'm surprised I didn't loose my license. It costs me a lot of money to get them all off my record. I now drive at a normal speed.

Harry loved hockey. He decided to sign up to play for a local league. Harry attended the tryouts for the team. Harry hoped he did well enough to make the team. A few days later, Harry heard that he made the team.

Gina was bored in detention. She decided to text her friend Mary across the room. She knew the mean teacher wouldn't approve. She kept her phone in her purse to hide it from the teacher. Mary texted back.
Stella twisted her ankle in a basketball game. It was a painful injury. She wouldn't be able to play for at least 6 weeks. There was a recruiter coming to her school next week. She was devastated.

Dan was walking home from school and saw the window display. There was a train set in the window of the store. Dan wished so badly that he could own this train set. When Dan got home his mother told him she had a surprise. She gave Dan the train.
Neil was visiting Egypt. He took a tour to see the Great Pyramids. He stared up at them in awe. They were so huge and ornate! Neil was fascinated by the scale and beauty of the pyramids.

Kaylee went to work at Cedar Point, the amusement park. While working at Cedar Point, she met James. Kaylee and James started to like each other and soon started dating. One year later, James proposed to Kaylee. James was sad about the proposal.

Mark and Molly had reservations for a popular restaurant. When they arrived the hostess seated them at their table. They ordered from the menu and waited on their food. When dessert arrived Mark asked Molly to marry him. Molly laughed in Mark's face and left.
Liza was surfing one day. Suddenly while paddling, she felt a sharp sting. She looked down and gaped with shock. A shark and nipped off one of her fingers! Liza hurried to shore.
My kids had head lice a while back. All four of them got it. We had to clean the entire house. We treated their hair twice to make sure it was gone. The source of the lice was never determined.

Ellen had a baby daughter who slept in a crib in her own room. One morning Ellen did not hear her baby fussing, so she went to check. Her daughter was not moving or breathing! Ellen called the police in a terrible panic. Ellen felt really calm.

Samantha wanted to watch a scary movie, but her mother said no. Her mother left for work, and Samantha decided to watch it anyway. The movie was so scary it gave Samantha nightmares for weeks! She wished she'd never watched it! Samantha learned her lesson.

Anthony was nervous for the big rugby match. His team was playing their rivals in the league. As the game began, the rival team quickly took the lead. Anthony and his team worked extra hard to fight back. His team gave up because they saw no way to win.

Opal asked her aunt for her famous beef stew recipe. Her aunt reluctantly copied down the recipe. Opal took it home and tried to replicate the stew. It didn't taste as good as her aunt's masterpiece. Opal's stew was better than her aunt's.

A man breaks into a house and begins to take things. He takes jewelry and games, some cash, and some food. When the family comes home they call the police. The police come and investigate and manage to track him. The police arrest him.
Max and May were at a tavern. They saw the dartboard and challenged each other to a game. Max played very well. But May thru even better than him. Max won the game.

Ray loved spending the day at the beach. He and his girlfriend spent hours laying in the sand, getting sun. Ray liked to read a book and listen to music on his MP3 player. His girlfriend liked to go in the water for a bit. They didn't like the beach anymore.
Sally bought herself grapes. Within a day they were gone. She didn't eat them. She asked her roommates but they all denied eating them. Sally ate the grapes.

Michael loved to go hiking in the woods on weekends. He had never made it to the top of a mountain. One day he climbed very high,and finally reached the top. He could see land and water on the other side of the mountain. Michael loved the view and hoped to return.

There was a boy in Gina's 6th grade class named Dave. It was the first week of school, but Gina knew she didn't like him. He would sit as his desk and giggle goofily. The sound of his goofy giggle made Gina's skin crawl. Gina did not like Dave.
Today was moving day. Unfortunately it started raining early in the morning. Since all of my things were packed, the move went quick. We got a little bit wet! I wish it had rained more.
Matthew's mother was busy working on the computer. Matthew screamed. Matthew stomped. Matthew's mother relented and abandoned her work. Matthew's mother finished all of her work on the computer.

John hadn't studied for his math test. The weather forecast was calling for snow. He went to bed hoping he would be saved by a snow day. When he woke up the next day school was cancelled. John was relieved to have an extra day to study.

Lauren was nervous about giving a speech for her French final exam. She arrived to class. It was her turn to give her speech. She finished her speech and felt relieved. The teacher was impressed and gave her an A on her exam.
Bob wanted to get a tattoo. He wanted to get one of a wolf. His girlfriend sketched a neat design. Bob got the tattoo done the next day. Bob hates tattoos.

I traveled to Washington DC to visit my boyfriend. We went many places around town. But one place I wanted to go was the White House. He took me to the White House, and I was so happy. We took the tour and enjoyed the history of the place.

Grace always loved playing tricks on the teacher. Her favorite trick was to hide all of the chalk from the teacher. One day as she was hiding the chalk, the teacher caught Grace. She was suspended from school for two weeks. Grace didn't miss a day of class that whole year.

Jesse had always wanted to get a tattoo. Her parents were very against the idea of tattoos. One her 18th birthday she decided to get one. She got a small tiara tattoo on her shoulder. Jesse's parents were upset with her.
A friend came to visit. I told her that my dog bites. She did not listen. she tried to pet him and play with him. My dog bit her.

Kim had eaten deer meat without knowing what type of meat it was. She found the thought disgusting. She ran to the bathroom as she gagged. By the time she reached the bathroom the gagging had subsided. She went back and had another large serving of deer meat.

Mia loved being outdoors. One summer, she decided to go mountain climbing. She joined a club of people who climbed mountains together. They climbed the tallest mountain in her area. Mia wished she could be indoors.
Jeff wanted to beat his mile run record of 6 minutes. So he practiced running every day. He ate more fruits and vegetables. And he felt much better. Jeff beat his old record and was happy.

Timothy had an urge to eat sweets. He was looking everywhere for something sweet to eat. He found what he was looking for. It was a gigantic cupcake his mom made. Timothy eat the cupcake in one big bite.

Around 11am, the school's fire alarm went off. Rushing towards the door, the students stopped when gunshots rang out. Then the teacher instructed them to hide under their desks. Diving under their desks, the students were petrified. They waited until the incident was over.

Charlie would eat anything. He was small, even for a chihuahua, but he loved food. His crowning triumph was when he stole a large pizza. Dismayed, his family rushed him a mean person they called Vet. Charlie changed his bad habits.
Pam's house was where the party was. Everyone bought gifts. Pam bought a cake. Everyone danced and had fun! Pam was a lousy hostess.

Gina realized she needed to get to work on her report. She had wasted the whole day and only had one left to complete it. She sat down and began to work. Her mother wanted her to wash the dishes. Gina was glad she had wasted her day.

Sal liked magic. He always tried to pulled tricks for his family. He tried to pull a rabbit out of his hat on day. But the hat ripped and the rabbit fell through. The people watching him congratulated him.
Walter wanted to travel. He decided to plan a trip. After researching, he picked a destination. A week before his trip a hurricane struck. Walter decided to extend the length of his trip.

My parents needed to buy a new television. They went to the electronic's store. They were overwhelmed by the choices but found someone to help. He made their decision easier with his answers. My parents bought a purple van with flowers on it.
Everyone in my family got together for Thanksgiving. It was a long journey for many, but they made it. We all sat together and ate dinner. After dinner, we visited and caught up. We had a great time.
Coy needed new sneakers. She went to the store and examined their selection. She settled on a lovely blue pair. And the price was just right, too! Coy bought a more expensive pair of sneakers.

Frank did not want to do his homework. He wanted to play video games instead. Frank's parents told him to do his homework first. Frank threw a tantrum and got punished. Frank lost his video games for a week.

My favorite movie is the Wizard of Oz. I used to think it was real when I was young. Whenever I watched it, I felt immersed in the movie. The characters took me away into the Land of Oz. One day, I decided to buy the movie.

I loved to eat honey with my oatmeal. One day I unexpectedly ran out of honey. I did not want to eat my oatmeal without honey so I went to the store. Alas, they had run out of their honey stock. I felt so defeated.

Kelly went to a Celtics game yesterday. She loved going to games. The clock was ticking and time was running out. Thankfully the Celtics won. Kelly was mad that the Celtics won and not the opposition.
Fred decided to buy some shares of Apple. The stock price was 90 dollars when he bought it. Luckily they had great earnings yesterday. The stock then went up to 100 dollars. Fred was very happy.

Eve needed a new couch in her parlor. But she could not afford to buy one! Then she went to a secondhand store and found a great one. She had it delivered and set up in her living room. Eve thought the couch was very comfortable.
I bought a new lamp today. I still need to set it up. I'm not sure where to put it. My mom thinks it should go in the corner. I put it on the night stand in the corner.
Kev and Kate were fighting badly. They decided they needed help. They went to see a therapist. The therapist was helpful and friendly. Katie hated her a lot.

When I was young I hated mowing the lawn. As I got older I never really liked it any more. Now that I have my own kids I make them mow the lawn. They hate it too. My kids and I are opening a lawn mowing company.

Gordon is in a rush to get to a meeting. He bursts out of the laboratory and slips on the ice outside. When he gets up he notices he has scraped his wrist. He barely makes it to his meeting on time. Gordon vows to be more careful next time.

Amy's class went on a field trip to see A Mid Summer Night's Dream. They arrived at the theater and found their seats. Amy was in awe of the actors discipline and talent. After the play she was able to speak with the cast. Amy told the actors she could have performed better.

Kate was interested in taking karate. Kate searched the yellow pages for a qualified school. Kate found a school that peaked her interest. In visiting the school, Kate was excited to join. Kate never went back to the school.

Yesterday I was at the mall shopping. To my dismay the alarm went on. Apparently someone stole clothes. Thankfully the perpetrator was caught. I heard on the news that night they sent the kidnapper to prison.
Linda passed by a bakery she never saw before. And she decided to go inside. She loved muffins. So she ordered a chocolate one and a banana one. Linda did not like bananas.
Sally like pizza night on fridays. The family got two pizzas one with no cheese. Sally didn't like cheese. But both pizzas had cheese on them this time. Sally was very happy to see cheese pizza.

Hannah had a beautiful cat that she loved very much. However, she noticed that her cat was getting very old. One day, her cat ran away and never came back. Hannah was devastated. She never saw her beautiful cat again.
I had a job interview last week. My girlfriend helped me pick out a new tie. We went to the store and looked for hours. I found three I liked. I bought all of them.
Todd was an aspiring artist looking for a new studio. He scoured the internet but came up empty. Then he called a realtor who found him one. She took him there. Todd loved the place on first sight.
I didn't like paying taxes. I enrolled in a Tax Preparer's class. I studied hard and long. I passed my Tax Preparer's class. I was happy I passed.
I changed the sheets on my bed last week. I was tired of the old ones. The new ones look nicer and feel better. I think I will keep them. I am happy they weren't too expensive.
Ben was late for class. His teacher yelled at him. He came in late the next day. His teacher wrote a note to his parents. Ben crushes his alarm clock and buys a chicken.

Lindy always wanted a great love in her life. Every day she went to the university where she studied with a rose. Her plan was to give the rose to a man who would be her great love. Lindy didn't know how to talk to a man she thought looking at the rose. Lindy decided she didn't like men.

The other day I decided I needed to research javascript classes. Sitting down at the computer I began my search on google. It was not long at all before I had results in front of me to help. The chosen result led me to an info page for online classes. I had just graduated with a degree in computer science.

Jim got his first credit card in college. He didn't have a job so he bought everything on his card. After he graduated he amounted a $10,000 debt. Jim realized that he was foolish to spend so much money. Jim decided to devise a plan for repayment.

I heard that dog parks were good for dogs. One day, I decided to get my dog and go to the park. I put my dog on a leash and got in the car. We finally arrived at the neighborhood park. I then turned around drove back home.

Dave decided one day he wanted to go see a nickelback show. He ordered a few tickets. He then invited some of his friends. They all went to the show, and had a good time Dave took control of the helicopter and landed on the field.
Harris was poor. He decided to rob a bank. He held up the bank at gunpoint and stole thousands of dollars. He escaped in his getaway car. Harris could not outrun the police and was caught.

Mom thought the living room furniture looked old and shabby. It was time for some new seating. She bought the perfect set. The new furniture looked and felt great. The living room had a brand new appeal.

Scott knew someone was stealing packages from his porch. He set up a surveillance camera near his door. He felt that he would at least have a video of the thief. One day, Scott saw footage of the perpetrator. Scott gave him a high five.

Jordy ran outside happily. He looked up at the sky to see countless snowflakes. With a gleeful yelp, he began constructing a snowman. When he was done, Jordy looked thoughtfully at his creation. He was ashamed of himself.

Amelia decided to take a vacation to Mexico. She booked her flight and hotel. When she got to Mexico, she was sure to visit many different things. She loved every moment of it. Amelia decided to never go back to Mexico.
Amelia had heard that you could eat dandelion salad. She was curious. She picked a few dandelions and leaves. Then she tossed them into salad and drizzled it with dressing. Amelia got poison oak.

Jill was surprised when a handsome boy asked her to the college dance. As her roommates got ready, Jill fussed about her hair. Jill's roommates said they could help. Jill finished dressing into her toga-like white gown. Jill and her friends had a fun girls-only night out.

Bill bragged about the Patriots all year. He would make negative posts about other teams on Facebook. He would brag about every win they made. The Broncos beat the Patriots in the playoffs. Bill is a huge Broncos fan.
Rose took a train to Long Island. There, she went to the very tip of the island. She went to the beach at Montauk Point. It was cold and windswept. Rose was so warm that she took off her jacket.
A boy needed to learn to drive. He asked his father and he said yes. They began to look for a first car. In the newspaper ads, they found a nice looking car. The boy bought a bicycle.

Joe turned on his computer and noticed a problem. There were programs he did not install and he could not delete them. Joe went to the store and purchased and antivirus program. Joe ran the program on his computer for hours. He was very happy that the program took that amount of time.
It was autumn. Todd's yard was full of leaves. He decided he needed to rake them all up. Once he was done, he put them all in a bag. Todd opened up the bag and spread the leaves around.

Ashley's dog has fleas and is scratching himself. Ashley was very worried that she would get fleas as well. She went to the store and put flea and tick shampoo. Ashley then went home and gave her dog a bath. Ashley's dog was full of live fleas.
Lee wanted to give his mom a nice gift for her birthday. But he had no money! So he decided to make her a card and cake. He put in lots of time and effort. Lee's mom hated it.

Jerry and Stacey had been dating for a few months. He knew he loved her but was shy about saying it. He finally mustered up enough courage and told her. She told him she loved him as well. Jerry and Stacey remembered this day for the rest of their lives.
Gina's knew pencils were gone. And she knew a boy named Dave had taken them. She decided she would confront him to get them back. She marched to his desk and begin yelling. Gina was very angry.

Jake opened his fridge, looking for food. He found nothing, except some jelly. He realized he could make a PB&J sandwich. He got the ingredients, and fixed himself a sandwhich. Jake satiated his hunger.
His first time at the opera. He only went after his girlfriend begged. He sat for three hours in sheer boredom. Finally it was over. He decided he loved the opera.

A man got very tired of being dripped on by his igloo. He built himself a new one out of dry ice. It solved his dripping problem. Unfortunately, dry ice sublimates into carbon dioxide gas. The man eventually died.

I decided to pay a visit to someone I've been dating online. I never seen her in person, but I trust her. The airplane flight took several hours. When I arrived at the hotel, she said she's in front. I walked in and saw her.

I wanted to hang out with my friend today. She was acting a little suspicious. However, I assumed that she was normal. Eventually she said goodbye to me in a rude manner. She then came over to my house.

Amy wanted to get a manicure. She went to the nail salon near her job. The lady finished and asked if she wanted fingernail polish as well. Amy chose a bright red nail polish color. Amy hated bright colors.

Gina liked to volunteer at a homeless shelter. She had spent Years going there for many hours a week. The staff decided to do something to show their appreciation. They chipped in and got Gina a gift. Gina stopped volunteering because she felt unappreciated.
Lucy loved writing poems. One day Lucy's mom was very upset. Lucy hated seeing her mom unhappy. She decided to write her a poem. The poem made Lucy's mom feel better.

Allison decided she wanted to learn more about her area's history. She went down to the library to check out a book on it. She went inside and couldn't understand how the books were sorted. She found a librarian who explained the dewey decimal system. That helped her figure out which car she didn't want.

Patrick's parents raised ducks. One day, Patrick was playing near the ducks. One of the ducks started chasing him! The duck caught up to Patrick and bit him on the leg. Patrick developed a fear of dogs because of the incident.
The cop pulled me over at night. He said I had been speeding. He went back to his car. I waited with the lights flashing behind me. I enjoyed talking to the officer.

Last night was very scary. We had a tornado warning and terrible thunderstorms. Unfortunately my concert for violin was not canceled. I was required to show up but during the performance lights went out. Nobody seemed to notice what had happened.

Gina's mom was upset with her. Gina had been sulking in her room all day. She decided to offer a truce. She washed the dishes as an act of goodwill. Gina's mom was happy and they had a great night together.

Nick was challenged to a volleyball match. His girlfriend bet him five dollars she could beat him. Nick did not intend to let her win! He played hard and mercilessly. Nick beat his girlfriend and she gave him the five dollars.
Vanessa hired a babysitter that liked to snoop. She snooped in makeup drawers. She snooped in jewelry boxes. She snooped in medicine cabinets. Vanessa caught her snooping, and fired her.

Fred decided to buy some shares of Apple. The stock price was 90 dollars when he bought it. Luckily they had great earnings yesterday. The stock then went up to 100 dollars. Fred regretted his stock purchase.

Ellen dreamed of winning a prize for her roses. She planned to enter her special purple rose at the fair. She fertilized the rose bush and covered it each night. The roses grew more beautiful every day. Ellen had to pay a replacement fee for her library card.

Mike was tired of work and needed a vacation. Unfortunately, Mike had no idea where he should go. He then decided to spin a globe and go where his finger landed. Mike's finger landed on Hawaii. Mike went to France.
On Saturday, we went to the beach. I applied sunscreen before we left. I did not read the instructions well. I didn't reapply sunscreen throughout the day. I was very pale when I got home.

Mark decided that he wanted a new puppy. Excited, he drove to the animal shelter. Once there, he wandered around and looked at all of the cats and dogs. A golden lab caught his attention. Mark adopted a parrot.

Jan and Kim were both using the Montessori education model. Kim decided to take away all dragon and fantasy books from her kid. Jan was upset that Kim made this decision. Jan argued that imagination and fantasy was important. Jan brought the books back.

My friends got me a jigsaw puzzle for christmas. I haven't opened it yet. I always keep planning to but something keeps coming up. Like right now talking with you. I can't wait to to start the paint-by-numbers set!

Neil took a flight into Bangkok. He walked around to see the sights. There were so many delicious local foods! And the souvenirs were wonderful, too! Neil stayed some extra days in Bangkok because of all the fun.

Nina loved drawing from an early age. She practiced and practiced and got really good. Nina went to art school but needed some cash. Nina began to sell her art on deviantart. Nina became a professional artist.

Laurie came home from the store one day and saw the door open. She was suspicious and called the police. When they arrived, they found a woman inside, stealing jewelry. She was arrested and they found many other stolen items with her. Laurie was glad the police came quickly.

The Oakland Raiders' starting quarterback was injured. Dave was their backup quarterback. Dave practiced the entire week with the first string offense. Dave felt he was ready to start the next  scheduled game. Dave felt prepared for the game.

The chief received the food from the waiter. He prepared his utensils. After taking the first bite, he immediately threw up. The waiter was fired and kicked out of the restaurant. The waiter and the chief decided to have dinner together.
I went to a renaissance fair with my friends. At the fair, there was a petting zoo! We went inside to see the animals. I got to pet so many wonderful animals. I will always cherish that day.

Anthony wanted to learn how to speak Spanish. He found an online Spanish course, and he enrolled. Anthony studied hard, and eventually he learned the language. Anthony speaks Spanish fluently now. Anthony could not get the language down properly.

Loo had a red box he kept pebbles he collected in. One day Loo went out to play with his friends. When he came back home he could not find his box. Loo asked his friends to help him find it. Loo didn't want the box anymore.

Rufus had always loved the soothing sounds of a cello playing. He resolved that he would learn cello one day. He enrolled in a cello course and practiced each night. Finally he was an expert at cello. Rufus was not very musical.

I wanted to buy a video game console. I asked my parents, and they came up with an idea. They said if I did my chores, I would be given money to save. I did my chores without being asked every week for a whole summer. My parents gave me enough money to buy the console.

Rob loved to play soccer and was on his middle school team. They had just started their season and were playing their first game. Rob accidentally tripped over another player during the game. The other player was mad, but Rob apologized and kept his composure. Rob ended up playing the best game of his life!

Jim lost his wallet that had all of his money it. He would have no more money for food for his family until next month. Meanwhile, Pete found a wallet lying in the bank parking lot. It contained hundreds of dollars and Pete really wanted a new TV. So, Pete kept the wallet and bought a new TV with the money.

There is this amazing gym near my house. It has all the workout equipment I could ever ask for. The best part is that the membership is only ten dollars per month. That's one of the cheapest I've ever seen. I'm happy to be a member there and work out often!

It snowed so hard that school was called off for the day. The boys put on their coats, hats, gloves and boots and went outside. They built a tall snowman and a snow fort. They had a snowball fight. They went inside to roast marshmallows.

Tony was tired of stale store bought bread. He called his mom and got her bread recipe. Tony gathered the ingredients that he needed. Tony baked the bread according to the recipe. It was some of the best bread he has had.
Gina and her friends were feuding. She was the only one who was an outcast. The other girls were getting along great. Gina kept her head down and kept working. Gina had the best day of her life.
All the girls get together for book club. They read a new book each month. Then meet to discuss it. After twenty minutes it turns into gossip. They have fun gossiping.

Noah was working as a waiter. One day he saw that a customer had left his wallet on the chair. Noah decided not to steal the wallet. Instead, he called the customer to come and get it. Noah kept the wallet.

Melinda wanted to go see a scary movie. She wanted to go by herself to prove she was brave. Melinda went to the movies and bought a ticket. Melinda was very afraid while watching the movie. Melinda thought the movie was hilarious.

Ivy wanted a cell phone like all her friends. She saved up her money from delivering papers. Soon she had enough for a phone. She went shopping and selected the perfect phone. Amy spent all of her money on clothes.

Gina was using a restroom at a gas station. She went to wash her hands, but there was no soap. She looked in the cabinet under the sink hoping to find some. There was no soap there either. So she had to settle for rinsing her hands off.

Joey's little sister was bugging him. He thought it might be funny to trip her. He tripped her, and she started crying. Their mom ran into the room. Joey was able to purchase camping equipment for his little sister.

Fred went to the beach with his friends. He loved the water and the sunshine. His friends threw a party on the beach after the sun went down. Fred got drunk and passed out on the sand. Fred rolled over and fell off the bed.
John was cooking dinner last night. He was making pork chops. Unfortunately, he dropped a pan and burned himself. He had to go to the hospital. John had a miserable evening.
Ann loved cake. Every saturday she would walk by the bakery. Ann loved to look at the beautiful cakes. One day a lady asked her to come inside. Ann felt insulted by the lady's offer.

Emily was very nervous to get her shots at the doctor's office. She hid under the table and cried. When the nurse gave her the shot, Emily reached out and hit her. Both Emily and the nurse were surprised and in pain. Emily's parents cheered her on.

Molly's computer broke last week and she knew she needed a new one. Her computer had fallen off of the table on accident. Molly went to the store to look for a new computer to buy. She wasn't sure which one was the best so she asked the worker. The worker recommended a few different computers to Molly.

Malcolm was a brilliant mathematician. He wrote many books on the subject. His books were easy to read and easy to understand. The helped people around the world. He found it very gratifying to share his expertise with people.

Sal hurt his leg when his wife accidentally tripped him. She felt so bad that she waited on him hand and foot. She bought him food and gave him messages. Sal liked all the attention. Sal's leg eventually healed.
Todd was tech savvy. He always had the latest of every gadget. He went to the local electronics store to browse. He eyed a new drone model that was just released. He bought the drone.

My grandma was on her deathbed. She told me to always take out time for the little things. I try to live this daily. I try to enjoy the things people normally take for granted. I thank my grandma for my giving me my life's philosophy.

Mark and Molly had reservations for a popular restaurant. When they arrived the hostess seated them at their table. They ordered from the menu and waited on their food. When dessert arrived Mark asked Molly to marry him. Molly said yes.

Jan's baby was born premature. She had some health difficulties. The doctor said that she needed to wear glasses to help her eyes. He prescribed special glasses for premature babies. Jan was confused by the doctor's prescription.
Mom got dressed up and Dad met her at the door. They went out for a date tonight. The fancy restaurant was perfect. Their meal was delicious. They decided to never visit that restaurant again.
This morning I was running late for work. I decided to get a coffee at the gas station. They only had decaf left. I was really upset while pumping gas. I never drank coffee.

I recently went to the zoo with my friends. We met there and entered together. We saw lots of animals, such as giraffes, monkeys, and elephants. We even were able to feed the giraffes. After the trip, we went home very happy.
Ellen always hated school. The kids made fun of her every day. They called her smelly Elly. She decided to start taking baths. Ellen liked the negative attention.

Ben was waiting at the crossroads for a lift from his friend Tom. Tom had said that he would pick him up at 8:00 PM and it was after 9. Ben was frightened by odd noises he heard coming from the darkness. After a while Tom walked out of the shadows laughing. Ben was annoyed that Tom had tricked him.
Alex needed groceries. She made a list of things to buy. She gathered her reusable canvas sacks. She walked to the store. She bought the groceries.
Josh liked bees. He thought they were good for the planet. One day, Josh got stung by a bee. It hurt very much. Josh doesn't like bees so much any more.

Holly was a beautiful black cat that Lee loved very much. Saddly, Holy got very sick and Lee had to put her to sleep. Lee was very sad missing Holly everyday. One day soon after a little black kitten showed up at Lee's back door. Lee decided to adopt the kitten.

Tom was tired of everyday life. So, he decided to move off the grid. His first week was ok, but soon he ran out of water. He suffered for two days and still couldn't find any. Eventually Tom went back on the grid.

Jessica wanted to feed the birds without buying feeders. She gathered a bunch of pinecones under the trees. Strands of ribbon were attached to each one. She rolled the pinecones in peanut butter and bird seed. She hung the pinecones from the trees and waited for the birds.

Joe and his neighbor supported different candidates. They put up yard signs to show their support. It became a bitter war, with new signs added daily. After the election, the neighbors met outside. The candidate they both supported won.

I went to a bar with some friends of mine. I was broke, but thought I could keep them company. It turns out that they were all broke as well. None of us bought anything, and we talked for hours. The bar asked me and my friends to leave after a while.
Danny likes to go on picnics. Paisley is Danny's girlfriend. One day, Danny took Paisley on a picnic. She enjoyed herself very much. Danny was happy he could share the picnic date with her.

There was a hurricane coming and we had to evacuate. We packed what we needed and headed to the other side of the island. We waited out the storm there with family. When it was over we packed our things and went home. We found our house standing, but in shambles.

Elena was a little person and was very insecure. She thought no one would want to date her. One day, she met a very nice full-sized man. They started dating and he accepted her condition. He brought a full-sized woman to his company's holiday party.
Larry hated going to the mall. He was stuck there last Saturday. It was particularly packed due to sales. He started having a panic attack in the middle of a crowd. A man helped him recover.
Harry loved hockey. He decided to sign up to play for a local league. Harry attended the tryouts for the team. Harry hoped he did well enough to make the team. Harry then quit his hockey team.
Jose was excited. He had just gotten a new skateboard and wanted to try it out. He took it straight to the skatepark. He skated all day. Jose threw away his skateboard.

Ron and Kim wanted a new house. Ron decided to work overtime at work as much as he could. In a few Years he had saved all his overtime pay and had lots of cash. He and Kim started shopping for a new, bigger home. They both purchased sportscars with the money.

Jill went on a road trip last month. She wanted to travel from Boston to Seattle. Halfway through, her car broke down. She spent hours on the side of the road, waiting for AAA. They fixed her car and sent her on her way.

Mary's family was getting together for a holiday dinner at the club. Everyone was going to be there except for Mary's Grandfather. Mary was sad that the whole family would not be together. When she got to the club, she was surprised to see her grandfather! Mary was so happy!
I love avocados. I ate a sandwich covered in them. After I ate it, my mouth was itchy and tingly. I talked to my doctor about it later. It turned out I was allergic to avocados.

Pam and Tom's baby was a light sleeper. Their thoughtless neighbor often left his dog outside barking all day. Every time Pam got her baby to sleep, the dog started barking. Pam fantasized about unleashing the dog so it would run away. One night, Pam let her cats inside her home.

Year's ago I decided to start buying Investment Bonds. I completed the forms necessary for payroll withholdings. The deductions started immediately. In 2008 the economy went bust which caused the bonds to lose value. I lost a lot of money.

My friend nathan and his family went to the lake one summer. One day Nathan's dad left and didn't leave a lighter for his mom. Well his mom was very upset and made him walk to the store barefoot. Poor Nathan had to walk down a gravel road to bring his mom matches. When Nathan returned, his mom apologized for being so mean.

Ron woke up and looked out the window. The street was covered in a foot of snow! School was canceled that day. Ron spent the whole day playing in the snow with his friends. Ron was very unhappy that it had snowed so much.
Josh loved Rachel very much. Rachel reciprocated that love. But they were from two different social backgrounds. They tried and tried to make their love work. But it just wasn't meant to be.

Ed and his twin Ethan were looking at women online. Then they saw a profile for two twin ladies. They called Sami and Sara and arranged a date. On their date, all four had a wonderful time. They decided not to see each other any more.

Carl looked into a telescope for the first time at 9-Year's-old. He was immediately breath-taken and full of wonder. He decided he had to learn more about the cosmos. He studied science and astronomy through high school and college. Carl then became a garbage man.

A mom took her kids to a family restaurant to eat. One of her kids was squealing with joy and laughter. Patrons at another table complained that the kid was too loud. They passed the mother an angry note. The mother was happy to receive the note.
Sean was homeless. He begged for money on the streets. For one week, no one gave him money. He was starving. Sean decided to go to a shelter.

Peg worked hard canning jam from her garden's fruit. When she finished, Peg admired her rows of jam jars. She decided they looked too pretty to eat. Much later, Peg finally opened one jar of the jam. Peg thought it tasted amazing.

Lenny wanted to learn to practice hypnosis. He did a lot of research about how to do it well. He found out that hypnosis doesn't work like he thought. He found that hypnosis is more of a parlor trick than a power. Lenny found a different interest.

Our kids had a 2 day break from school. So we decided to take a fun trip to Great Wolf Lodge. The kids enjoyed swimming at the water park. We enjoyed pizza and story time after swimming. We all had a good time.

It was midnight, and Lynn's family was asleep. Lynn and her friends decided to meet some boys at the park. They decided it would be dangerous to sneak out her room window. So they went to the basement. Lynn and her friends snuck out of the basement door.

Ella's dad had to go on a business trip to Munich. Ella begged her dad to bring her with him. She had never been to Germany and she wanted to see it! Her dad agreed and brought Ella with him on the trip. She had a wonderful time.

Opal asked her aunt for her famous beef stew recipe. Her aunt reluctantly copied down the recipe. Opal took it home and tried to replicate the stew. It didn't taste as good as her aunt's masterpiece. Opal asked her aunt to make her some stew.

A plumber was called over to fix a leaky sink. He took out his tools and got to work. The problem was that two pipes did not fit together perfectly. The plumber replaced one of the old pipes with a newer pipe that fit. Finally the sink was repaired.
I invited a girl I like to the movies last week. She said yes. We decided to watch a comedy. It was pretty funny. I felt very sad while watching the film.

Tam, the star of a popular musical came down with laryngitis. Her understudy Sal, would have to perform opening night! Sal gave a wonderful performance. The director made Saul the new star. Saul's career took off.

Tuie was a very spoiled dog who liked to be completely covered up. She would always try to get underneath Adam's blanket. Adam got tired of his blanket smelling like a dog. He went to the store and bought her a blanket of her very own. Afterwards,  Tuie.

Renee was inspired by the music of Eddie Van Halen. She decided to learn to play guitar. She bought an electric guitar and an amp. She hated pressing the strings with her fingers. Renee decided she would have to get used to it.

Hank grew out a large beard. His friend told Hank that he looked like an old homeless man with it. Hank went home and intended to shave it off. He brought the razor close to his beard and paused. Hank hates hairy faces.

Florence wanted to find something fun to do one afternoon. She decided to drive to the lake to go fishing. At the lake she met three other people who were also fishing. Although she did not catch a fish, Florence had a great time. Florence and her new friends went fishing again the next day.
I went grocery shopping the other day. I had a long list of items. I picked up every item on the list but one. There were no carrots in the whole store. I bought carrots at a different store.

I was walking to the mall. Someone was calling me and I decided to pull out my phone. I had a hard time getting it out since my pockets were tight. The phone ended up jumping out of my pocket. I almost cracked my phone.
James wanted to look cool. He decided to get a mohawk. He shaved his head himself. His mom said he looked dumb. James was sad with his mother's comments.

Lenny wanted to watch a movie. He drove to the local Hollywood video. Lenny rented three horror movies. Lenny went next door and bought a pizza from a shop. When he got home, he prepared to return his three movies.

The shepherd opened the gate of the pen. He sent his dog into the pasture to round up the sheep. The dog herded the sheep towards the gate. The sheep moved together into the pen. The shepherd then released the sheep.

Shari was worried. Her wedding was tomorrow, and it was an outdoor ceremony. But rain was forecast! Thankfully, the wedding day dawned clear and sunny after all. The festivities went on without a hitch.
Miranda just got her driver's license. She took the family van out for a spin. She drove for a long time. But then she realized she was lost. Miranda was happy about her proud moment.

Joey's little sister was bugging him. He thought it might be funny to trip her. He tripped her, and she started crying. Their mom ran into the room. Joey spent the afternoon alone in his room grounded from friends.

Becky has a cousin named Ashley. Becky and Ashley used to be friends when they were kids. Ashley started being stupid when she grew up. She went to jail for stealing tampons from a dollar store. Becky is proud of Ashley.

Pat was playing a pick up soccer game. The other boys were playing rougher than he was used to. One boy slide tackled Pat as he was going in for a goal. Pat landed on his wrist and felt a snap. Pat had to go to the hospital.

Peyton and Tom played football often. Tom always won for many Year's. Peyton never gave up and kept practicing. Peyton finally beat Tom at a game of football. Tom was a bad sport and punched Peyton in the face.

Meg couldn't find her favorite gold earrings. She was beginning to suspect the new maid had stolen them! Her husband admonished her to search the house more carefully. Meg realized that perhaps they had been vacuumed up by mistake! Meg checked the vacuum and then found them.

After getting off the school bus, I realized that my phone is missing. Since there was service on it, I decided to cancel it. The customer service representative did it for me. In addition, he said that there was a call made to Jamaica. I knew someone would soon return the phone.

I just became a certified personal trainer! I have been working at this for Years. My wife took me out to dinner to celebrate. I told her at dinner all the plans I have to bring on clients. I left the table before she could speak.

Jake's dad took him to his first football game. They got there early and had really good seats. They ate hot dogs and drank soda as well! Jake even saw his favorite player during the game! Jake did not have fun that day.

Billy would wake up every morning and get ready for school. First he would take a shower to start getting ready. Next Billy would have to get dressed. After he was fully clothed he would eat breakfast. Billy was very methodical.
Sky went to Turkey with her class. She landed in Istanbul and started sightseeing. All the students loved the architecture. And they thought the food was great too! Sky never wanted her trip to end.

Mark was starting a new job the next day. He was nervous about being around so many strangers. He barely slept any the night before due to anxiety. When he entered the building he was greeted warmly by many people. He realized he would fit in perfectly at the new job.

When I woke up in the morning, I went downstairs. I smelled the smoke coming from the turkey. I also smelled ham, macaroni and cheese and lasagna. My mom finished cooked everyone and asked me to sit down. I sat down and continued to enjoy the smells from the kitchen.

Gayle and her husband were skipping rocks at a lake. Gayle picked up a smooth round rock to throw. The rock skipped four times before sinking into the murky water. Gayle's husband selected a large bumpy rock to throw. Gale was not married.

My boyfriend and I were on vacationing on the beach. We went to a beach that was inhabited by wild dogs. One dog, named Rubia, watched our things while we swam. We were so happy, we brought her meat the next day. Rubia was a very mean dog.
Calling people at night is risky. If you call after nightfall, be prepared. I did this the other night and got yelled at. I did not like that so I hung up. I started making more late night calls.

I'd ordered two flash drives. I walked down to the mailbox in the deep snow. I was frustrated to find only one package. I was more frustrated to find both my items should have been in it. I called the shipper.

Don and his wife drove to a video rental shop. After half an hour, the two couldn't decide on a movie to watch. Don asked the owner of the shop to pick out a movie for them. The owner selected a popular romantic comedy starring Katherine Heigl. Don and his wife gave up and went home.

One day Alice decided to climb the tallest tree in her yard. She got to the top, but was too scared to climb back down! Alice's dad had to get the ladder to climb up to get her. They made it safely to the ground, but Alice learned a big lesson. Alice decided to not climb the big trees anymore.
Alicia liked where she lived. One day, her parents told her they were moving. She was very sad. On moving day she said goodbye to her friends. Alicia was happy to be leaving her old house.

Bob had very long legs, and Sally was having a hard time keeping up. She was too proud to say anything, but she'd fallen far behind. Bob stopped in mid-sentence when he realized he was talking to air. He looked back and realized what had happened. Bob took shorter steps so it was easier for Sally to keep up.

Kaylee went to work at Cedar Point, the amusement park. While working at Cedar Point, she met James. Kaylee and James started to like each other and soon started dating. One year later, James proposed to Kaylee. Kaylee and James were married in the fall.

Tommy trained hard to run his first 5K. During the race he felt frustrated when so many people passed him. When he heard his name called during awards he was shocked. He didn't realize they would do awards by age group. He was ashamed that he didn't get any recognition.

Rob was driving with his friends. They were driving all night just for fun. When they got to downtown the car started to sputter. It ended up stalling in the middle of an intersection. They soon went home.

Alex was getting fits of dizziness. He was so nervous that he checked his symptoms online. The online results convinced him that he had a terrible disease. He scheduled an appointment with his doctor in a hurry. Alex found out his blood sugar was low.

Sara wanted to do something for her sister who has cancer. The chemo caused her sister to loose all her hair. Sara went to the hair salon and had her long hair cut short. She then had the hair made into a wig. She threw the wig into the trash.
James had a birthday coming. He wanted a hunting bow. His mother went out and bought him one. He forgot to ask for arrows for the bow. He carved some sticks to use for makeshift arrows.

As a boy I really wanted to meet a girl like my mother. But as I grew I found different traits desirable. Hanging around other boys made me happy inside. I realized quite quickly that I might be gay. I bought oysters and champagne.

Mary was pissed at Paul for forgetting their anniversary. Paul had to think quick. He decided to call his friends to help fix things. They helped him set up an amazing party and invited everyone. Paul brought his mistress to the party.
Neil flew into Russia. There, he visited tourist sites and saw friendly locals. He found that Russia was colorful and vibrant. It also had a great and rich history. Neil found the trip dull.
Joe stretched as he rolled over in bed. His clock showed it was 10 am. He jumped out of bed, panicked. His alarm hadn't gone off. Joe was late for work.

I had heard Mr White and Mr Black argue for months. Today I suggested Mr Black call the police on Mr White. Mr Black said the 911 operator was sending the police. I witnessed Mr White stabbing Mr Black. Mr White and Mr Black invited me to their wedding.

Ed wanted to make homemade juice for his family. He bought a bag of oranges and juiced them. Then he chilled the juice overnight. In the morning, he served it to his family. It was the best apple juice that they had ever had.

Mike was in charge of the local flea market. A man called him and asked for a spot at the market. Mike told him it would cost $40 to set up a table. The man on the phone tried to bribe Mike with some of his wares. Mike hung up on him.

Blake loved to go hiking. He would always take his favorite boots when he went hiking. One day, Blake went on a really rough hike. He stepped through jagged rocks and rugged terrain. Blake took off his boots and continued bare foot.

Jerry wanted to start a new career. He searched the classified ads for job postings. He found a desirable posting in one of the ads. He emailed his resume to the recruiter. Jerry decided later it was easier to collect unemployment.

Linda went to buy some frozen yogurt. She saw some white yogurt and assumed it was vanilla. She loved vanilla, so that was what she got. She tasted it and it was horrible. Linda was very disappointed.

Seth has worked at the air conditioning factory for six Year's. One day his supervisor calls a meeting for the entire department. Seth's supervisor announces that the factory has to shut down. Seth realizes in terror that he needs to find new work. Seth thinks he can find a job at the air conditioning factory.
It was a beautiful summer day outside. Bob decided to go for a walk at the park. Bob walked along the path and admired the scenery. He found a twenty dollar bill on the ground. He was disappointed.

Rick was at the bar when he saw a driver license on the ground. He asked around if it was anybody's there. Of course it wasn't, and Rick didn't want to leave it with a stranger. So he decided to drive to the address of the license owner. Rick gave the license to the driver and made the driver happy.

Gwyneth's family was hosting a foreign exchange student. He was from Algeria and had never seen snow. One day in December, they awoke to see the ground covered in snow. He was delighted and ran outside in his shorts to jump in it! He was very happy to see snow for the first time.
My brother got a ticket. He never went to court. He eventually got pulled over again. They arrested him for failure to appear. The judge convicted him of murder.

Cindy's room had white walls. But she complained that they reflected too much light. So she decided to have her walls painted blue. She thought her room was more calming. She was pleased with the results.
Rob like salsa. So his friend Tom got him a large case of a rare variety. Tom was excited to give the gift to Rob. Rob opened the gift in disbelief and drew a smile. Rob was disappointed.

Sally needed to file some papers. Before that she needed to make copies, though. She knew this meant walking down to the basement. Once she was down there she made copies. She went back up and filed all the papers.

James was twelve Year's old and loved food. He never really thought about making food until today. His mother let him help fix rice for dinner. James learned how fun and creative cooking could be. James decided to become a chef when he grows up.

Every year I have a Christmas party at my house. This year was no different. I grabbed my friends together and we had a party. I got it catered and had a DJ as well. All my friends had a lot of fun at the party.

Mike bought a new bike to ride in his town. He cycled from his house to a friend's house. On the way he met a group of kids riding bikes as well. Neiter Mike nor the kids were wearing helmets at the time. Mike didn't like riding bikes.

Amelia was getting ready for a date at a nice Italian restaurant. Amelia's friend had set her up on a blind date a week prior. She got to the restaurant early and waited for her date. Thirty minutes had passed and her date did not show up. Amelia went back home.

Gina sat on her grandpa's bed staring outside. It was winter and his garden was dead until spring. Her grandpa had passed away so there would be no one to tend it. The weeds would take over and strangle the flowers. Gina asked her grandpa what kind of flowers he liked best.
